ARABIC: وَنُفِخَ فِى ٱلصُّورِ ذَٰلِكَ يَوْمُ ٱلْوَعِيدِ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: The Trumpet will be blown. That is the Day of the Threat.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And the trumpet blast will sound: It would be the Day of Doom.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: And then the Trumpet was blown. This is the day of the promised chastisement.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: The trumpet will certainly be sounded. This will be the day (about which you) were threatened.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And the Trumpet was blown; “This is the Day of the promised punishment.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And the Trumpet will be blown -- that will be the Day of the threat.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And the trumpet shall be blown; that is the day of the threatening.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And the Trumpet shall be blown; that is the Day of the Threat.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And the trumpet is blown. This is the threatened Day.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: The trumpet will be sounded. This is the Day [you were] warned of.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And the trumpet will be blown: this is the Day of the Threatening.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: And the Trumpet will be blown: ‘This is the promised day.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And the Trumpet shall be blown: that will be the Day whereof Warning (had been given).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And the Trumpet will be blown, that will be the Day whereof warning (had been given) (i.e. the Day of Resurrection).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: And the Horn shall be blown; that is the Day of Threat!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And the Trumpet is blown: “This is the Promised Day.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And the Horn will be blown. That is the Day of [carrying out] the threat.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [50:20] And the Trumpet will be blown, for resurrection. That, namely, the day of the blast, is the Day of the Promised Threat, of chastisement for the disbelievers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And the trumpet is blown) this is the blowing of the resurrection. (This is the threatened Day) the threatened Day of the first and latter nations.
